data.title: RPS Battle
data.statement:
Give the final score of a Rock-Paper-Scissors BO3 battle (2 players). In a BO3 (best of 3) battle, the winner must <<win two out of three games>> in order to win the contest. A player get 1 point for winning a game and 0 point for losing a game. When there is a draw, both players get 0 point and the game is ignored.


<<If you are not familiar:>>
Rock-paper-scissors is a hand game played between two people, in which each player simultaneously forms one of three shapes with an outstretched hand. These shapes are "rock" (a closed fist), "paper" (a flat hand), and "scissors" (a fist with the index finger and middle finger extended, forming a V).
It has only two possible outcomes: a draw / a win for one player and a loss for the other.
- Rock beats Scissors
- Scissors beats Paper
- Paper beats Rock

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Give the final score of a Rock-Paper-Scissors BO3 battle (2 players). In a BO3 (best of 3) battle, the winner must win two out of three games in order to win the contest. A player get 1 point for winning a game and 0 point for losing a game. When there is a draw, both players get 0 point and the game is ignored.


If you are not familiar:
Rock-paper-scissors is a hand game played between two people, in which each player simultaneously forms one of three shapes with an outstretched hand. These shapes are "rock" (a closed fist), "paper" (a flat hand), and "scissors" (a fist with the index finger and middle finger extended, forming a V).
It has only two possible outcomes: a draw / a win for one player and a loss for the other.
- Rock beats Scissors
- Scissors beats Paper
- Paper beats Rock
Input
Line 1: A number N for the number of games played
Line 2: N strings S, separated by spaces, which represents each play of player one
Line 3: N strings S, separated by spaces, which represents each play of player two
Output
A single line containing a string "s1-s2" where s1 is the score of player one and s2 the score of player two
Constraints
S is either ROCK, PAPER or SCISSORS
N ≥ 2
Example
Input
3
ROCK PAPER ROCK
PAPER ROCK SCISSORS
Output
2-1
